description: Probably a corruption of the Spanish peseta  +‎ -een.

entries.meaning: (now historical) A Spanish silver coin worth two reales, used as common currency in the Americas in the 18th century. [from 18th c.]
examples: [T]hose poor souls never had more than nine pence per day, and seldom more than six pence, from their masters or owners, though they earned them three or four pisterines  […] .
